intro: Hesperis malcolmioides, commonly known as the Malcolmioides bellflower, is a species of flowering plant in the Brassicaceae family. It is native to the mountainous regions of southern Europe, particularly in the Pyrenees and Alps. The plant produces showy, violet-blue flowers that bloom in early summer, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. It prefers well-drained, calcareous soils and thrives in full sun to partial shade. Hesperis malcolmioides is often found in alpine meadows and rocky habitats, where it contributes to the biodiversity of its native ecosystems.
